definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: In some ways I agree with those who want stricter punishments.
sentences.chinese: 我在某些方面同意那些从严惩处的人的意见。

sentences.english: Applied strictly, the test would knock out too wide a swath of patents.
sentences.chinese: 如从严适用，该检验方法对专利打击面过大。

sentences.english: Strictly speaking, the answer isn't correct.
sentences.chinese: 从严的说，这个答案不正确。

sentences.english: On this occasion, strictness is a must.
sentences.chinese: 在这一场合，从严治党，是必须进行的。

sentences.english: Food safety strictly control and care of life responsibility rushan.
sentences.chinese: 食品安全从严把关，关爱生命责任如山。

sentences.english: At the same time, governing the Party strictly is the constant policy of our party.
sentences.chinese: 从严治党是我们党的一贯方针。

sentences.english: Victims' associations lobby for longer prison terms for criminals.
sentences.chinese: 受害者团体则通过游说要求对罪犯从严判决。

sentences.english: Insist to treat according to law sternly Jing, establishment the mechanism of scientific management.
sentences.chinese: 坚持依法从严治警，建立科学管理机制等。

sentences.english: The report was verified, will be severely dealt with.
sentences.chinese: 有关举报一经核实，将从严处理。

sentences.english: We will strictly control the number of new projects undertaken.
But a louder chorus wants the rules strictly interpreted.
sentences.chinese: 但是更多党内人士一致认为，应从严解读这些规则。

sentences.english: In class management to strictly utilitarian, strict management.
sentences.chinese: 在班级管理中要严字当头，从严管理。

sentences.english: To administer the Party is decided by the nature of the Party.
sentences.chinese: 从严治党是党的性质所决定的。

sentences.english: They had been talking of stiffer sentences for criminals.
sentences.chinese: 他们刚才一直在谈论对罪犯的判刑要从严。

sentences.english: We will continue to run the army strictly in accordance with the law and raise its level of standardization.
sentences.chinese: 坚持从严治军，依法治军，提高军队正规化水平。

definition: to strike a severe blow/to crack down/to take strong measures
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to be strict/to enforce vigorously (procedures, quality control etc)
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
normalized (statistics)/to normalize (relations etc)/to become the norm
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
to bring under control/to regulate/to restore to good condition/(coll.) to fix (a person)/to prepare (a meal etc)
